channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Federal judge to hear arguments over whether to block immigration arrests in US schools
Measles outbreak spreads as experts warn of lasting immune effects
item.description: At least 164 measles cases have been reported across nine states this year, with two unvaccinated patients — a child in Texas and an adult in New Mexi...

item.title: A look at some of the creative ways companies try to dodge high tariffs
item.description: Companies can try to avoid or minimize tariffs by requesting exemptions or legally reclassifying their products. Here's a look at some of the strategi...

item.title: Investigation advances into Gene Hackman’s mysterious death, with update by New Mexico authorities
The job market is still pretty solid -- but there are warning signs ahead
item.description: U.S. employers added 151,000 jobs in February, while the unemployment rate inched up to 4.1% from 4% in January.

item.title: Monthly jobs report to be released. And, the White House to host a crypto event
item.description: The Labor Department will release the monthly jobs report card today, which is expected to show solid growth. But that's not the whole picture. And, t...

item.title: Paris trains halted and area evacuated after WW2 bomb found
item.description: The unexploded bomb was found on tracks near the station, with all Paris trains, plus Eurostar to Brussels, suspended.

item.title: Olympian wanted by FBI on drug ring charges
item.description: Former Canadian snowboarder Ryan Wedding has been placed on the FBI's 10 most wanted fugitives list.

item.title: Donald Tusk announces military training plan for all Polish men
item.description: Poland's prime minister said his government plans to have a model ready by the end of the year.

item.title: Fears of destruction as 'erratic' cyclone nears Australia
item.description: Four million people across Queensland and northern New South Wales are in the firing line.

item.title: Google launches AI-powered scam detection for Android users
item.description: Google has launched new AI-detection tools to help protect Android users from scams. For more on the new features, CBS News was joined by William Anto...

item.title: Farmers strongly back Trump. A new trade war could test their loyalty
item.description: American farmers have stood firmly behind President Trump even when his trade policies hurt them. The latest trade war, which could be even worse for ...

item.title: A South Carolina man is set to become the first executed by firing squad in 15 years
item.description: A South Carolina man convicted of murder is scheduled to be executed by firing squad Friday night. Brad Sigmon beat to death his ex-girlfriend’s paren...

item.title: Ringo Starr on embracing country roots
item.description: Ringo Starr made his Grand Ole Opry debut in Nashville last month, performing the country classic "Act Naturally," a song he and The Beatles first cov...

item.title: Aspirin could stop some cancers from spreading, study finds
item.description: A new study, published in the journal Nature, looked at animal experiments and found that aspirin enhanced the ability of the immune system to fight b...

item.title: Worst violence in Syria since Assad fall as dozens killed in clashes
item.description: A group that has been monitoring the civil war said 71 people died in clashes between the two sides.

item.title: U.S. Army soldiers accused of selling military secrets, including to China
item.description: Attorney General Pam Bondi said the soldiers will "face swift, severe, and comprehensive justice."

item.title: How a measles outbreak overwhelmed a small West Texas town
item.description: The kindergarten vaccination rate against the measles in Gaines County is 82%, far below the 95% needed to achieve herd immunity.
